document.title: The Data Protection, Privacy and Electronic Communications (Amendments etc) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019

articles.title: Citation, commencement and extent
articles.text:
(1) These Regulations may be cited as the Data Protection, Privacy and Electronic Communications (Amendments etc) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019.
(2) These Regulations come into force on exit day.
(3) These Regulations extend to England and Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.

articles.title: Interpretation
Amendments to the GDPR
articles.text:
(1) Regulation (EU) 2016/679 is amended as follows.
(2) In the basis of this regulation, any reference to a member State is to be read as a reference to the United Kingdom.
(3) The references to the European Union and the European Economic Area are to be treated as references to the United Kingdom.

articles.title: Amendment of Article 3
articles.text:
(1) Article 3 is amended as follows.
(2) In paragraph 1, for "in the Union" substitute "in the United Kingdom".
(3) In paragraph 2, for "in the Union" substitute "in the United Kingdom".

articles.title: Amendment of Article 27
articles.text:
(1) Article 27 is amended as follows.
(2) In paragraph 1, after "representative in" insert "the United Kingdom".

chapters.title: Amendments to the Data Protection Act 2018

articles.title: Amendments to section 3 of the 2018 Act
articles.text:
(1) Section 3 of the 2018 Act is amended as follows.
(2) After subsection (14), insert—
"(14A) The Commissioner has the functions conferred on the Commissioner by this Act."

articles.title: Amendments to section 17 of the 2018 Act
articles.text:
(1) Section 17 of the 2018 Act is amended as follows.
(2) In subsection (1), omit "Member State".

articles.title: Saving for existing processing
articles.text:
(1) Processing of personal data which was lawful immediately before exit day continues to be lawful after exit day.
(2) This regulation is without prejudice to any amendment made by these Regulations.

articles.title: Transitional provision for consent
articles.text:
(1) Where a data subject gave consent to the processing of personal data before exit day, that consent continues to be valid after exit day.
(2) Nothing in this regulation affects the right of a data subject to withdraw consent.
EXPLANATORY NOTE
(This note is not part of the Regulations)
These Regulations are made in exercise of the powers in section 8(1) of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018 (c. 16) in order to address failures of retained EU law to operate effectively and other deficiencies arising from the withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the European Union. They amend Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the Data Protection Act 2018 (c. 12), and the Privacy and Electronic Communications (EC Directive) Regulations 2003 (S.I. 2003/2426).
